posts.content:
Hey guys I was hoping you could help with a build I wanted to use, but after a lot of tries have failed myself. (I think I might be taking the wrong feats.)
Anyway, I was hoping to get help for a build that was viable in both Arelith, and Amia both have a level cap of 30. Arelith seems to have a restriction on classes (such as 3 classes then a new one can be chosen) Amia doesn't. I was hoping to make a swordsman, whom focused on a longsword, I was hoping for dual wielding but (a shield is also acceptable ^^)  that might not be viable, anyone knowledgeable in this that can help? I don't think there are any noticeable changes besides that. I'd prefer to be human (if possible), but wouldn't mind doing an elf either.

Thank you.

Welcome to the guild Neptulon!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Here it is Neptulon, in the 30's build section,

Arelith Sword Master => http://nwnecbguild.forumer.com/topic/23 ... Pfyb-FS38M

Unfortunately, detailed skill selection isn't there but maybe someone else that uses the Excel program can help you. Myself, i always use a simple rule of thumb to allocate skill points that i will tell you about it. I always take the indicated skill points only when they are class skills for the current class, unless the builder has indicated otherwise. In the above case i have shown that Spellcraft ranks are Cross-Class skill by including this (cc)* sign. Everything else must be taken only when it is a Class-Skill for the corresponding class. One thing, make sure you have 4 ranks in Intimidate by your third level (for entering WM) and you should be alright.

Thanks a lot Valerfor, appreciate it ^^. Was kind of curious, will the build work well if the scimitar is replaced with Longsword, or is the scimitar ideal?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: It will certainly work well with everything but when we have so high an AB it's best we take a high-critical weapon such as the Scimitar Or a Rapier. Another good weapon to be used with a Weapon's Master is the Axe. The longsword is the middle road so to say, nothing bad about it, but if you want to bring a huge smile in your face, take the Scimitar and never look back, half of your hits (55% to be axact) will be critical hits with a keen weapon.
